text: Differential nuclear localization of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins in human accessory cells of the immune response in situ .

The Rel / NF-kappa B proteins , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , constitute a family of transcription factors involved in the positive regulation of a variety of genes during the immune response .
Recently , it has been shown that <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> knockout mice have no dendritic cells ( DC ) .
An overexpression of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been described in follicular dendritic cells ( FDC ) .
A constitutive NF-kappa B activity has been reported in mature macrophages .
This led to the hypothesis that some of the Rel / NF-kappa B proteins were key nuclear factors in functions of accessory cells of the immune response .

Therefore , we investigated in situ the nuclear localization of Rel / NF-kappa B proteins in accessory cells of the immune system by immunohistochemistry and double labeling by immunofluorescence from five normal human tonsils and five lymph nodes with follicular hyperplasia .
Nuclear <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins were found in all cell types including lymphocytes .

In germinal centers GC , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were found in the nuclei of FDC only and were not detected in the nuclei of <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells .

In T cell areas , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were found in the nuclei of <extra_id_0> HLA-DR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells with an antigen-presenting cell ( APC ) morphology .

<extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were detected in the nuclei in both <extra_id_0> CD1a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + and <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells from the T cell area , whereas <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was found only in <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> CD1a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - cells .

Cells with nuclear <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were negative for the <extra_id_0> CD38 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD20 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> markers .

These results show that , physiologically , high levels of nuclear of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are restricted to accessory cells of the immune system , which include FDC in GC , and DC and macrophages in the T cell zone , that specialized scavenger macrophages from GC do not have detectable levels of <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas macrophages from the T cell area , known to present the antigen to T cells , do have both nuclear <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and that in the T cell zone , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are located in nuclei of both <extra_id_0> CD1a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + , <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + or both , cells APC , whereas <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is restricted to <extra_id_0> CD1a <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> CD68 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - APC .

The different patterns of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein nuclear localization may provide insight into their different roles during the immune response in vivo .
